content.description: Climb a short corner ( same as Crescent Crack), join a splitter tips crack, follow it as it arches right (5.11d), then join an awesome tight hands splitter (5.10+) for 60'. Find some rests and feet up high!
content.protection: A hand-size or two at the start (2.5"-3"); then use small Aliens/Camalots(3/8th"s) for the crux; a mix of sizes up to 2.5" for the rest of the way up. Bring extra 2" pro. Find a 2 bolt anchor on top.

content.description: Climb face holds up and right towards obvious splitter finger cracks. Surmount small roof before following thin crack as it arches up and right (5.10). You switch cracks high up before anchor.
content.protection:
3/8" (blue Aliens) - 1", bring extra 3/4" (yellow Aliens or 0.4 Camalots). A two bolt anchor is reached at 70' near the splitter for

Deliverance

.
content.location:
This route begins 10'-20' to the climbers' right of

McComb Crack

.

content.description: Climb an obvious splitter hand and fist crack through small bulge, and then follow it up and left into a chimney (5.10+). This is a really fun warm-up for the harder and longer routes in the zone. Look for obvious red steak coming from the traversing section of the fist crack near the anchor.
content.protection: Friend sizing: 2.5"-3.5" ; extra 3.5". A 2 bolt anchor is located in chimney at 90'.
content.location:
This crack is 20' or so right of

Crescent Crack

and

Swim Simulator

.

content.description: Climb tricky sidepulls into short, right-facing corner before traversing right beneath small ledge (5.11 with good gear); then follow a hand crack into a double roof. One #5 Camalot protects cool OW move through roof (5.10) and then an awesome long hand crack leads to "30 Something Ledge" (5.10).
content.protection: Friend sizing: 3/8"-3.5" - heavy on hand sizes, 1 #5 Camalot, and small wires.   There is a 2 bolt anchor at 140'.
content.location:
This route is located in the center of the 10 Mile Crag and is 30 feet climber's left of the start of both

Swim Simulator

and the

Crescent Crack

.

content.description:
Climb a short corner to horizontal cracks, good gear placements (5.9). Gain a small ledge left of the start, and then head up blunt arete left of ledge past 3 bolts before a splitter crack emerges (5.11c). Follow splitter - mostly 1" baggie finger jams with feet. It tightens at the top, and a two bolt anchor is visible.

Our truck got stuck on the way home from this one...almost 10 miles from Dove Creek. We lucky caught a ride and a tow from some true locals, and the name for our new route become clear that night.
content.protection: Friend sizing: 3/8th" to 2", small wires, 3 bolts, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is located climber's right of main of Ten Mile Crag. Ten Mile Crag is located 10 miles from Dove Creek and 5+ miles down river from the Pump House Crag.

content.description: Dazed and Confused is located on the backside of a large pillar and faces up river. Climb a splitter that splits wall near a chimney in a corner (5.9). Climb a short off-width until it joins three separate hand-sized splitters (5.10+). A two bolt anchor is located in small alcove at 130' or so.
content.location: This route is located on the far climber's left side of Ten Mile Crag. Ten Mile Crag is located 10 miles from Dove Creek and 5+ miles down river from the Pump House Crag.

climbs.name: Crescent Crack
climbs.fa: K. Alinger, I. Altman, M. McComb, 1996

content.description:
Climb a left-facing corner (5.10) towards the seem crack of "

Swim Simulator

", but then stay in this obvious line of weakness to the top. This corner becomes an amazing, crescent, arching flake towards the top with tight hand jams and foot holds around (5.10+).
content.protection:
Friend sizing: 1/2"-4", bring many 2"-2.5". A 2 bolt anchor is located above the "30 something Ledge". This anchor services

Swim Simulator

,

Jive Turkey

, and Crescent Crack.
content.location:
This is located just to the climber's right of "

Swim Simulator

" and in the central wall of the 10 mile Crag. Both

Swim Simulator

and Crescent Crack share the same start. This was the first route completed on this wall in 1996.

content.description: Start from a cool hangout ledge. Climb a corner for about 15 feet to ledge below a roof. Pull around roof on good hands with cool features on the right. A #4 Camalot protects the start of the traverse left nicely. Bust left on cool moves with tricky foot work in a splitter crack to an alcove just below another roof. Climb tight hands through the roof and above to a short section of wide. Finish with cool face holds to the anchor.
content.protection: 1 each: 0.3 - 0.5; 2 each: 0.75 - 4; extra red Camalots; and a chain anchor.
